issue.title: Thin leakcanary-watcher

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Turning it into a small shippable module

See #1247

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.title: LeakSentry

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
* leakcanary-watcher only has the reference watching code
* New leakcanary-sentry module
  * Automatically watches fragment and activity references on app startup
  * Tracks support fragments if the support fragment class is in the classpath
  * Can be configured with LeakSentry.config
  * LeakCanary builds on top to add heap dump and heap dump analysis
  * leakcanary-sentry is lightweight enough that it can be used in production
* leakcanary-analyzer is now a pure Java module, no Android
* Moved instrumentaiton tests to leakcanary-android

Fixes #1247

issue.title: Question: change of artifacts when migrating to 2.x?

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
If I understand correctly `com.squareup.leakcanary:leakcanary-android` now contains support fragment stuff (see #1247). So I no longer need a separate declaration for `com.squareup.leakcanary:leakcanary-support-fragment`. I guess that also makes sense that `leakcanary-support-fragment` [didn't get updated to 2.x](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.squareup.leakcanary/leakcanary-support-fragment)

How about the no-op artifact `com.squareup.leakcanary:leakcanary-android-no-op`? Do I still need that for no-op functionality? Can I continue to rely on v 1.6.3 for that since [it too didn't get updated to 2.x](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.squareup.leakcanary/leakcanary-android-no-op)?
